Are you part of a flood group in #Devon, #Cornwall or the #IslesofScilly? 
Join our Community Hub and #BeFlood Ready: https://t.co/Fu3FfOlZwg

#FloodGroup #FloodResilience #BeFloodReady @DevComsTogether @EnvAgencySW @CwllCFloodForum https://t.co/dd9Wo1iLqk

Just to remind you all that just 24 hours ago the @EnvAgency admitted it will no longer be publishing serious pollution incidents and won't be recording them against their annual performance targets. https://t.co/Cu3VPjycTa

The Chess today. According to @EnvAgency 34 days of continuous storm sewage discharge is having a negligible impact on the river!  We beg to differ!! @RiverChess @ChilternsAONB @ChilternSociety https://t.co/Eq1sORKeiE

tweets.text: The criticism directed at @EnvAgency after @RachSalv found that it is removing river pollution targets from performance reporting has been huge. You would think @JamesBevanEA would explain his thinking but he never engages so shouldn‚Äôt be surprised at calls for him to resign.

Year 1 had a great lesson this afternoon learning all about the water cycle delivered by Leanne from @stwater . The children particular enjoyed ‚ÄòThe Three P‚Äôs Song‚Äô üòÉüí©üíß https://t.co/VXQEWKGqsX

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency This is shameful and despairing. What is our government REALLY doing to protect our environment and wildlife in these critical times? Absolutely nothing by the looks of it. Unless it makes them money personally they couldn't care less.

urls.title: Fostering Prosperity: driving innovation and creating market opportunities through environmental regulations
urls.description: Join us on 2 March 2021 at 9.30am - 11am for the launch of Aldersgate Group‚Äôs latest report, Fostering Prosperity, which focuses on how environmental regulation can accelerate business innovation, create new market opportunities, and promote job creation. The UK has set commendable objectives on the climate and environmental agenda. tweets.text:
We've been planting trees around the Memorial Gardens in #York, to replace four trees we took out in 2019 to create space to build flood defences. For every tree we remove on the #YorkFAS we are planting five new trees. 
https://t.co/fjLkV5dh5t https://t.co/1QCwiAgj9B

tweets.text: @stewart_mounsey Have you dredged the rivers?

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Just why are @thameswater so untouchable? Seriously what can we do about this? New houses in my village with Sewage bubbling up in the bath, Sewage being poured into my local river. How can we fix this?

Blue skies this morning and peaks have now gone through on bigger rivers but lakes are still high - next 6-10 days looking dry @EnvAgencyNW teams will be making sure all flood defences are ok for next time and we will do a review of our response so we continually improve https://t.co/6u01eLMYtX

"The net effects (of climate inaction) will collapse ecosystems, slash crop yields, take out the infrastructure that our civilisation depends on, and destroy the basis of the modern economy and modern society", warns @EnvAgency in a burst of brutal honesty.
@WilliamNB @EnvAgency Bookmarking tide tables too in case the route uses the towpath to Pill. Regularly submerged during spring tides now :) https://t.co/452PfEV3CP

Some news! After five brilliant years I leave my job leading flood in #TeamEA - but I don‚Äôt go far- from today I‚Äôm our Exec Director of Operations working with our frontline teams on all EA activities water, biodiversity, regulating industry and of course floods! Can‚Äôt wait :) https://t.co/FkeIBPvdth

tweets.text: @FiDaisyG @EnvAgency Many thanks for this! I wasn't even aware it existed :-)
@WilliamNB 5 day flood risk map @EnvAgency is useful for checking long distance #ActiveTravel routes before you leave home #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/CxiBeHBW8j

The fact that the route crosses the Somerset Levels has a downside, though: it remains possible that flooding on the levels will at times mean you cannot cycle all of the route, so *always* check for news of flooding before setting off

I am aware that the smell from the landfill was particularly bad overnight. Many constituents have complained to @EnvAgency, @NewsNBC, or both.

I have written to the EA and to Red for an explanation.

Report odour to the EA via 0800 80 70 60 or ics@environment-agency.gov.uk https://t.co/DHj0O6B0f5
@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency One for you @TheCentricLab

There are still #flood warnings and flood alerts in place across #Cumbria and heavy showers are expected this evening. 

Are you prepared? Check the latest situation in your area and sign up to our free flood warnings: https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn https://t.co/vVurIbgb6z

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text:
In a welcome move, and in response to the rising number of complaints from local residents, the Environment Agency has announced this afternoon that it will undertake a new air quality monitoring exercise at Walleys Quarry landfill site.

More here: https://t.co/2km6xhFDGQ

urls.title: Agency bows to pressure and agrees three-month air-quality monitoring at Walleys Quarry | Newcastle-Under-Lyme Borough Council
urls.description: In a welcome move, and in response to the rising number of complaints from local residents, the Environment Agency has announced this afternoon that it will undertake a new air quality monitoring exercise around Walleys Quarry landfill site. The Environment Agency (EA) is the body responsible for monitoring the site and also regulates the environmental permits held by Red
